headline: Deviled Egg Dip
description: Turn deviled eggs into an easy, delicious dip with creamy labneh.
recipeIngredient: 4  to 6 cornichon pickles, or 2 tablespoons sweet relish
3/4 cup labneh or full-fat plain Greek yogurt
1 teaspoon white wine or distilled white vinegar
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more as needed
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more as needed
3  dashes vinegar-based hot sauce such as Tabasco, plus more as needed

recipeInstructions.name: Step 1
recipeInstructions.text: Place 6 large eggs in a medium saucepan and add enough cool water to cover the eggs by an inch or two. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove the pan from heat, cover, and let stand for 9 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare an ice bath by filling a large bowl halfway with ice and water.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 2
recipeInstructions.text: Remove the cooked eggs from the pan with a slotted spoon, tap each gently on the countertop to crack the shell in a few places, then submerge in the ice water for at least 1 minute. Peel the eggs and grate them on the large holes of a box grater into a medium bowl. Use a fork to mash the eggs until they are coarsely ground.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 3
recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the following, adding each to the bowl of eggs as you complete it: Finely chop 4 to 6 cornichon pickles, if using, until you have 2 tablespoons, or measure out 2 tablespoons sweet relish. Finely chop 1 small shallot (about 1/4 cup). Drain and finely chop 1 tablespoon capers.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 4
recipeInstructions.text: Add 3/4 cup labneh or full-fat Greek yogurt, 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon Dijon or horseradish mustard, 1 teaspoon white wine or distilled white vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric, 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and 3 dashes hot sauce. Stir to evenly combine.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
recipeInstructions.text: Finely chop the leaves and tender stems of 6 sprigs fresh dill or parsley (about 2 tablespoons). Thinly slice 1 small bunch fresh chives until you have 2 tablespoons. Stir half of each into the dip. Taste and season with more salt, pepper, and hot sauce as desired.

recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the dip to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with paprika if desired, then garnish with the remaining herbs. Serve with crackers or crudités.

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The dip can be made 1 day ahead without the herbs. Refrigerate in an airtight container, then stir in the herbs right before serving.Storage: Leftover dip can be kept refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

review.reviewBody: Great recipe.  Everything went together very well.  Thank you.
Can't wait to try this brilliant recipe!

name: Deviled Egg Dip

author.name: Rachel Perlmutter
author.description: Rachel Perlmutter is a recipe developer, food stylist, and culinary producer at The Kitchn. Originally from Houston, Texas, she spends her free time trying to perfect kolaches and breakfast tacos that taste like home. Rachel currently lives in Brooklyn with her partner, dog, cat and rabbit, where they all share a love of seasonal local produce.
